info.title: User Management API Docs
info.description: the openAPI spec for User Management

servers.description: set it to your target server name

post.description: Generate presigned URLs for uploading user avatar image to S3. Returns URLs for PUT (upload) and DELETE operations. Avatar will be stored in 'avatars' namespace.

get.description: Get the status of a flow and all its associated tasks

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The flow ID to retrieve status for

schema.description: The flow ID to retrieve status for

post.description: Batch endpoint to retrieve last login times, verified addresses, and invitation details for multiple employees. User must be company staff for all employee companies. No batch size limit.
Validates requestor's Hydra token and returns a new access token for the target identity

post.summary: Exchange Okta token for Hydra token
post.description: Validates Okta OAuth token and returns a Hydra access token for the target identity

Sets up a support account by checking if an identity exists for the support email. If not, creates a new identity and binds it to the company staff. The support email is composed as support.<company_slug>@workstream.us.
Remove email or phone from user's Kratos identity traits. User must retain at least one login method.

get.summary: Get me and other necessary data for the mobile app
get.description: Get the current user's identity, accounts and function_modules and other necessary data for the mobile app
Get list of pending identity merge conflicts for the authenticated user, limited to first 2 machine-detected conflicts

post.description: Reject a specific identity merge request by setting is_reject to true

post.summary: Exchange client credentials for access token
post.description:
Exchanges OAuth app client credentials for an access token.

The returned token has sub = owner_identity_id (the identity that created the OAuth app).
This allows third-party applications to authenticate as the identity that owns the OAuth app.

**Request (JSON or form-urlencoded):**
- client_id: The OAuth app client ID
- client_secret: The OAuth app client secret

**Response:**
- access_token: Bearer token for API access
- token_type: "bearer"
- expires_in: Token lifetime in seconds

Resend OTP code for any active postlogin flow (verify phone, add login method, forget password, merge account). The API automatically determines the contact method based on the flow's current task and sends the OTP accordingly.
Update current user's preferred name and profile metadata (name, address) using partial updates

get.summary: Get identity profile by identity ID
get.description: Retrieve identity profile information including email, phone, and job titles for payroll and company staff accounts associated with a specific identity in a company context. Company ID is provided via X-Core-Company-Id header.

parameters.name: identity_id
parameters.description: The identity ID to retrieve profile for

schema.description: The identity ID to retrieve profile for

parameters.name: X-Core-Company-Id
parameters.description: The company ID to filter accounts

schema.description: The company ID to filter accounts

get.description: Get unread message and task counts across companies and merge account count
Retrieve the authenticated user's identity information including email, verification status, and profile traits

post.summary: Batch get identity login data by company staff identities
post.description: Internal API for monolith to retrieve last login times and verified contact addresses for multiple identities. No authentication required. Returns data in same order as request. Maximum 100 identity IDs per request.

Creates a new invitation or updates an existing one. When resend_invitation is true, refreshes the expiration date to 90 days from now and triggers email/SMS resend. Side effects: (1) Updates invitation record in database, (2) Sends invitation email and SMS concurrently if resend_invitation=true or for new invitations, (3) Triggers state transition through invitation lifecycle.

Atomically resolves an identity conflict after Kratos OTP verification. Validates the Kratos flow, applies rate limits, removes the identifier from the source identity, and creates a new identity with the verified identifier. This is a single atomic operation - no separate initiation step needed.

get.description: Retrieves the current status of a conflict resolution.

post.description: Send OTP code to email or phone associated with an invitation. The contact value must match the invitation's profile_email or profile_phone. OTP expires in 10 minutes with max 5 verification attempts.
Verify OTP code for an invitation. Returns success status and error message if verification fails.

get.description: Lists all OAuth applications owned by the authenticated identity.

parameters.name: owner_identity_id
parameters.description: Identity ID to list OAuth applications for

schema.description: Identity ID to list OAuth applications for

post.description:
Creates a new OAuth application for the authenticated identity.

The application can be used to obtain access tokens via the client_credentials grant.
Tokens obtained using this application will have the 'sub' claim set to the owner identity ID.

**Important:** The client_secret is only returned once during creation. Store it securely.

## Usage:
After creating the app, use the client_id and client_secret to obtain tokens:

```
POST /oauth2/token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=client_credentials
&client_id=<client_id>
&client_secret=<client_secret>
&scope=<requested_scopes>
```

get.description: Gets details of a specific OAuth application. Does not return the client_secret.

parameters.name: owner_identity_id
parameters.description: Identity ID that owns the OAuth application

schema.description: Identity ID that owns the OAuth application

delete.description: Deletes an OAuth application. This will also revoke the client in Hydra, invalidating all tokens.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the OAuth application to delete

schema.description: ID of the OAuth application to delete

parameters.name: owner_identity_id
parameters.description: Identity ID that owns the OAuth application

schema.description: Identity ID that owns the OAuth application

patch.description: Updates an OAuth application's name, description, or scopes.

post.summary: Complete OAuth2 flow natively without browser redirect
post.description:
This API allows mobile apps to complete the entire OAuth2 authorization flow without browser redirects.

## Flow Overview:
1. Mobile app initiates OAuth2 flow with Hydra (/oauth2/auth) and captures login_challenge from redirect
2. Mobile app authenticates user via Kratos (passkey, password, OTP, etc.) and obtains session token
3. Mobile app calls this endpoint with both login_challenge and session token
4. Backend validates Kratos session, accepts Hydra login challenge, and auto-accepts consent
5. Backend returns authorization code that can be exchanged for access/refresh tokens

## Security:
- The login_challenge cryptographically binds the OAuth request to the authentication session
- This prevents session injection, CSRF, and replay attacks
- PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) must be used by the client
- This endpoint should ONLY be called by trusted first-party mobile applications

## Example Mobile App Flow:

### Step 1: Initiate OAuth2 flow with Hydra (capture login_challenge)
```kotlin
val authUrl = buildAuthUrl(
    clientId = "my-mobile-app",
    redirectUri = "myapp://callback",
    codeChallenge = pkce.challenge,
    codeChallengeMethod = "S256",
    scope = "openid offline_access profile email",
    state = randomState()
)

val response = httpClient.get(authUrl) {
    followRedirects = false  // Don't follow, capture redirect
}

val loginChallenge = extractLoginChallenge(response.headers["Location"])
```

### Step 2: Authenticate with Kratos
```kotlin
val kratosSession = authenticateWithKratos() // Passkey, password, OTP, etc.
```

### Step 3: Call this API
```kotlin
val result = apiClient.completeOAuth2Flow(
    kratosSessionToken = kratosSession.token,
    loginChallenge = loginChallenge
)
val authCode = result.authorizationCode
```

### Step 4: Exchange authorization code for tokens
```kotlin
val tokens = exchangeCodeForTokens(
    code = authCode,
    codeVerifier = pkce.verifier,
    redirectUri = "myapp://callback"
)
```

## Why login_challenge is required:
The login_challenge ensures that:
- The OAuth request parameters (client_id, redirect_uri, code_challenge) are cryptographically bound to this authentication
- An attacker cannot inject a victim's session into their own OAuth flow
- Each authentication is tied to a specific, time-limited OAuth request
- CSRF and replay attacks are prevented

email.description: Email address associated with the account

job_titles.description: List of job titles for payroll accounts

UserservicefxBasicIdentity.description: Basic identity information including emails, phones, and preferred name

UserservicefxIdentityDataResult.description: Complete identity data with Kratos identity, company staffs, and employees

UserservicefxQueriedProfile.description: The specific employee or company staff profile that was queried, only populated when querying by profile

accounts.description: All user accounts (both company staff and employee) across different companies

company_locations.description: Map of company UUID to all locations within that company. Companies are extracted from identity data.

X-Task-Chat-Channel-Id.description: Chat channel ID for the request
